results.title: Farmer Charley
results.brief_description: One of the cartoon series featuring the character “Charley”. In this film Charley is willed a half-interest in a farm and has rosy dreams of rustic bliss, but the reality shows him that a farmer’s life requires expert knowledge and scientific skill - as well as good hard work.

results.title: The Farmer
results.creator_credit: Milan Herzog and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Dramatises the daily activities of a teenager and his young brother and sister, the children of a typical American farmer in the Midwest. The film pictures the farm as a modern, inviting, pleasant place on which to work and live.

results.title: Farewell to childhood
results.creator_credit: Julian Roffman, Herbert Kerkow and Mental Health Film Board
results.brief_description: Shows common problems of adolescents and their parents. A moody 15 year-old girl clashes with her parents when they frustrate her efforts to “run her own life”. Mistakes by the parents, such as scolding her in front of her young escort, widen the rift between parents and daughter. Conditions improve when the girl’s teacher arranges a thorough discussion of adolescent problems, bringing more tolerance to both sides.

results.title: A Faroe Islands family
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Nordisk Films Kompagni
results.brief_description: Illustrates the geographical features of the Faroe Islands, showing how they affect the lives of the inhabitants, making farming difficult. Highland pastures afford grazing for large flocks of sheep and a few horses and cows. The wool is plucked by hand and carded, spun and woven in the farm houses. Extensive fishing operations are a mainstay of the economy of the islands.

results.title: A Far off world
results.brief_description: A love story set on another planet. A girl finds herself in doubt about a relationship with her friend. She seeks advice from the Master of the Planet. He grants her wish but she finds later that it is not quite what she had in mind.

results.title: Fantasia Di Botticelli: La Calunnia
results.creator_credit: Carlo Carlo Ludovico Ragghianti and Romor Film
results.brief_description: The Florentine painter Sandro Botticelli was one of the greatest products of the Renaissance. His sinuous and telling outlines are so exceptionally decorative and expressive that they place his work amongst the finest creations in the history of art. His admiration of classical art is most powerfully evident in his recreation of “Calumny”, a lost masterpiece painted by a Greek artist Apelles in the third Century B.C. “The Calumny” is the centre point of the film around which the developing style of Botticelli is examined.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Carlo Carlo Ludovico Ragghianti and Romor Film

results.title: Family tree
results.creator_credit: Evelyn Lambart, George Dunning, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The story of the settlement of Canada, illustrated with cheerful animated cartoons. The arrival of Jacques Cartier, the fishing and fur trades which followed, and the rival colonization by the French and British, climaxed by the battle of the Plains of Abraham, are depicted. The coming of the United Empire Loyalists is seen; then the west-coast gold rush and the completion of the transcontinental railway. New branches were added to the family tree when many European settlers came to fill the great spaces of the Prairies. Finally, we see the whole country matured into a nation, its traditions enriched by those of many peoples.

results.title: The Family: the boy who lived alone
results.brief_description: A young boy, Billy, runs away from home. As he walks, he observes others who appear lonesome. The film captures many of the thoughts Billy has about his family. After a wet, uncomfortable night in an abandoned house, Billy’s desire to become part of his family again increases and he decides to return home at daybreak.

results.title: The Family prince
results.creator_credit: Jeannine Locke and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: A candid look at the relevance and romance of the British monarchy from Prince Charles, Prince of Wales. Bridging the Prince’s frank, on-camera comments, the narrative script is combined with historical film footage to study the evolution of Crown and Commonwealth in modern times and to look at Charles’ younger years.

results.title: Family portrait
results.brief_description: An impression, by the late Humphrey Jennings, poet, painter and film maker, of the spirit and traditions of Britain and its people. Made in celebration of the Festival of Britain, 1951. Credits include: music by John Greenwood; photography by Martin Curtis; narration by Michael Goodliffe; music direction by conductor Muir Mathieson.
